True success in any line of work is not the result of chance or accident or destiny. It is the outworking of God's providences, the reward of faith and discretion, of virtue and perseverance. Fine mental qualities and a high 
                                                                           258
moral tone are not the result of accident. God gives opportunities; success depends upon the use made of them. --Prophets and Kings, p. 486.  {ChS 257.10}  
     Those who are impressed to enter the work, whether in the home field or in the regions beyond, are to go forward in the name of the Lord. If they depend on God for grace and strength, they will succeed. At the beginning their work may be small, but if they follow the Lord's plans, it will enlarge. God lives. He will work for the unselfish, self-sacrificing laborer, whoever and wherever he may be.--Southern Watchman, April 9, 1903.
